title: "Gangplank is overpowered with Kleptomancy keystone"
body:
https://lolalytics.com/ranked/worldwide/current/platinum/plus/champion/Gangplank/
http://champion.gg/champion/Gangplank/Top?league=
http://na.op.gg/champion/gangplank/statistics/top

in all 3 sites, he's sitting within 49%~51% win rate as of now in all elo. Kleptomancy just adds on to Gangplank's fantasy as the saltwater pirate without making him anywhere near overpowered. Looking at the pick rate, 9%~15% is certainly pretty high, but it is not high enough to indicate any problem either for now.

He is not overpowered. Rather, it just seems relatively overpowered because he became a viable pick.

replies.body:
Gangplank has to make pretty big concessions for taking Kleptomancy. One of them being any semblance of an early game. Not that GP's early game was great to begin with, but if you invest into this keystone then you have absolutely no ability to do anything in lane aside from shoot the other guy and get money. I think that's a decent trade for his above average late game.

Also, GP only gains 5 gold per shot now. Yes, he has a chance to get one of those RNG gold items that grants gold, but there's no telling if or when you'll get them. All in all, I like this Kleptomancy playstyle. It feels very pirate-y, which is a good thing when you're playing a literal pirate.

If you nerf the tools, then you stop the current problem, and prevent new ones.

And to be fair, {{item:3057}} has needed a nerf for a while. -40% damage on turrets when spellblade procs isn't so bad.
But no one else is abusing the tools so clearly it’s not the tools just Yorick. And sheen doesn’t need a nerf

No, it's the tools, _Yorick is just the most effective champion at using them_.  The other splitpushers, like Sivir and Tryndamere, don't stack HP like Yorick does, and thus don't utilize Demolish like he does.

So if literally no one in the game uses demolish to become broken like he does then why nerf it. If the tool was busted then there would be multiple overpowered split pushers. However Yorick is currently the only split pusher breaking the game so if you nerf Yorick another champ doesn’t come to take his place. This is because champs do not get stronger as a result of nerfing other champs.

The only way someone would be able to take his place is if someone was less but almost as powerful like twitch is #1 and Trist and kog are both close seconds. In Yoricks case there is no close second because unlike adc items the tools are not busted.

Yorick is an exception to the rule, he shouldn't get nerfed because they blanketly released a tool that he can utilize to idiotic levels. He stacks HP and AD. Demolish gets more powerful based on your HP.  Therefore, Demolish needs to be addressed, and Yorick does not need to be nerfed. 

If we keep nerfing champions because tools that are released are breaking them, then those champions become 100% reliant on those tools to be viable. If Yorick is nerfed based on Demolish, he's going to be utter shit if he's not taking Demolish. This creates huge problems for champions, because it essentially guts their play diversity by requiring that they take specific runes or items.

And as a note, I've seen 2-3 bruisers on a team nuke towers. They don't split, sure, but when there are multiple champs Demolishing towers, and basically making them worthless piles of rubble, then the keystone needs to be looked at. It's entirely too strong for what it is, and it allows for games to be steamrolled really quick once tanks and bruisers get their HP items online.

Thunderlords doesn't exist anymore. That can't be a tradeoff if it isn't even an option. The closest replacement to tdl is electrocute, which doesn't proc off GP ult like thunderlords did. That argument makes very little sense.

As for the "gp loses early game presence by taking klepto" argument, that's also pretty weak. Any early game power on gp isn't utilized. It's like winning a hundred dollars at the cost of an old wrench you've never used. Ya you lose a wrench, but the actual impact it has in your life (or gameplay in this case) is little to none.

Also, I never said it comes with a 0 tradeoff. I said " with almost no tradeoff". I was very careful to pick those words because I recognize he loses out on *some* stats but it's really barely impacts him in a meaningful way.

_**here's the statement that really matters though**_
You trade essentially meaningless early game stats for a safe + more reliable early game that speeds up your scaling into your dream lategame. That's the current situation that Klepto has given us in terms of GP's gameplay.

It doesn't make him over-powered, it just creates a very binary, boring, and quite unfun source of gameplay in League.

That's a matter of opinion tbh. Is it really a klepto rune problem if only 3ish champions abuse it? Would it be better to address the rune as a whole and potential overnerf it for those that don't abuse it, or is it better to address it at an individual champion level? I personally would like to see it's rewards halved for ranged champions, or something *similar* to that, but we're talking about preferences now. 

But ya, I was careful to not blame Gangplank's *kit* as the reason he's toxic. I was just highlighting what makes him an abuser and why.

I main Garen, and when I face GP I just don't care about him.  He pokes me and I just heal up, even after he gets sheen.  I have to be a little bit careful when he finishes trinity, but then he goes back to doing nothing after I finish another item.

Klepto can be great, but the majority of GP players don't seem to know how to turn a gold advantage into a lane advantage, and it's honestly embarrassing to watch.  A good GP should honestly come back to lane on his first back and start wrecking a melee opponent like Garen, particularly with the amount of gold Klepto can get you.
His playstyles is really annoying to play against, but not overpowered. Like yasuo and almost all skirmishers basically.

Top lane he won't kill you, which is fine if you're a tank wanting to play the waiting game?

Since top laners generally don't have global presence, and are in the most isolated position, they tend to also be unable to get kills or influence elsewhere. GP just sits under the turret, farming and outscaling with gold passives, while still having map presence with his ult. That's the annoying part; you can't kill him, you can't farm to outscale, and you need some way to reach your dmg spike before you fall off.

A champion could sit overpowered for 5 years and nobody says a thing until some pro mentions it and then out of nowhere it's spam the boards time. Not saying this has anything to do with Gangplank but I'm tired of seeing the same bug and OP posts over and over as if they just found it out themselves.
